declarations.name: createTRPCRouter
declarations.description: Creates a new tRPC router instance for defining API endpoints and subrouters. Used as the main entry point for building the tRPC API structure.
declarations.remarks: Should be imported and used throughout the /server/trpc/routers folder to compose routers and endpoints.

parameters.description: Accepts an object defining the router's procedures and subrouters.

declarations.signature: createTRPCRouter: <T extends Record<string, any>>(procedures: T) => TRPCRouter<T>
declarations.implementationNotes: This is a direct export of t.router from the initialized tRPC instance, with SuperJSON transformer and custom error formatting.

declarations.name: publicProcedure
declarations.description: Base procedure for defining public (unauthenticated) tRPC queries and mutations. Does not enforce authentication, but session data may be available if the user is logged in.
declarations.remarks: Use this to define endpoints that do not require authentication. For protected endpoints, use a different procedure with authentication middleware.

parameters.description: Accepts input and output schemas, and resolver logic for the procedure.

declarations.implementationNotes: This is a direct export of t.procedure from the initialized tRPC instance, with SuperJSON transformer and custom error formatting.
